accessibility.text: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures inflation as experienced by consumers in their day-to-day living expenses
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures inflation as experienced by consumers in their day-to-day living expenses
The Producer Price Index (PPI) measures inflation at earlier stages of the production process
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures inflation as experienced by consumers in their day-to-day living expenses
The Producer Price Index (PPI) measures inflation at earlier stages of the production process
The Employment Cost Index (ECI) measures inflation in labor costs
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures inflation as experienced by consumers in their day-to-day living expenses
The Producer Price Index (PPI) measures inflation at earlier stages of the production process
The Employment Cost Index (ECI) measures inflation in labor costs
The BLS International Price Program measures price changes for imports and exports
The Gross Domestic Product Deflator (GDP Deflator) measures inflation experienced by both consumers as well as the government and  firms providing goods and services to consumers.
